messages.content:
You act as the interviewer, and I act as the candidate being interviewed for a SDE = 1 position with 0 years of experience. 
Your role is to ask only one theoretical Computer science interview question to me, and wait for my response, 
once I provide my response then provide feedback on my answer, offer suggestion for improvement, and discuss effective communication technique. 
Be friendly, warm, and limit your response to three sentences each but do not make it a conversation. 
Remember to ask one question at a time and then patiently wait for my response each time you ask a question, and avoid repeating the same question. 
After providing your answer, always end with a question This is my resume. 
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Data Engineering Intern (CIS) | Marsh McLennan Global Services	Mumbai, MH
Worked on Proof of Concepts for LenAI, an inhouse AI tool                                                                         June 2023 - September 2023
Building a Document based Question Answer retrieval chain using Langchain
Build a Excel and csv query agent utilizing OpenAI and PandasAI
Developed test apps for both pdf query and pandas agent using streamlit	
Building a Custom LLM using Dolly-v2-3b, Dolly-v2-7b, Dolly-v2-12b using corporate data to fine tune it.
Working with Open AI and Hugging Face embeddings
Focused on Scalability to scale it up for the whole organization utilizing Azure Data Bricks and Data Lake

Data Science Intern | Jio Platforms Limited	Mumbai, MH (Remote)
Worked on implementing probability ML models to predict network tower usages	December 2022 - March 2023
Used with libraries like orbit and pymc3
Did modeling for almost 70 Lakhs rows of data for all the level - 7 geohashes of the mumbai region 
Achieved MAPE of less than 9% for almost all 3 Lakh Geohashes

ACADEMIC PROJECTS
Options Trading Strategy implemented in Live Market using TradingView                                                       October 2023                                                                                     
Implemented a trading strategy using EMA crossovers
Taken considerations like volume and volatility 
Generate Signals and Take trades automatically in live open market and get live notifications on any device
Achieved 38 % profitability using 1:5 Risk:Reward Ratios
Daily Shorts News App                                                                                                                                       October 2022
Created a short news app using News API and with google authorization for login
News can be browsed through different categories and also based on keywords searched
Added a top headlines feature which can also top headlines category wise
Tech Stack - Django, HTML , CSS, Bootstrap, News API
CNN Candlestick Pattern Prediction                                                                                                                             October 2022
Used VGG16 model and VGG19 model of CNN
Predicting  patterns like ascending triangle, triple top etc.
Achieved Testing accuracy of 66.7 %
Football League Database                                                                                                                                                  April 2021                                   
Created a database with 6 different tables
Performed various queries to get and distribute awards in League like Best Striker, Best Coach, Team with most goals, etc.
Tech Stack- SQL, MySql. 
You should be conducting an interview about two specific projects mentioned therein. This interview will take total 10 minutes in duration with 5 minutes dedicated to each project respectively. As a representative of a software company, your primary focus will be on the technical aspects of these projects. During this 
conversation, you will expect detailed answers to individual questions you will ask about each project. Please ask additional questions based on my responses to deepen 
understanding. Each question you pose will be limited to 30 words and your answers will be cross-referenced with the details in your resume for verification.

content.content: Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready ?
Yes, we can start
So, while going through your resume you have worked on a project named Daily Shorts. Can you describe that a little ?
Yes, I created a news app which works on NEWS API and I have created it using Django. It also have google authorization with search capabilites
Sounds Exicting !, Can you tell me why you used Django instead of other framework. Let's say over Flask

Absolutely, Flask is a fantastic framework known for its simplicity, but for this project, Django's built-in features were pivotal. The integrated admin interface, robust ORM, and convention over configuration approach significantly reduced development time. Django's batteries-included philosophy meant that we had a lot of functionality out of the box, reducing the need to integrate and configure multiple external components. While Flask offers more flexibility, Django's built-in features provided a solid foundation, aligning well with the project's complexity and scalability requirements.
Sounds good, moving on to the other project about Football League Database Project. Can you tell me more about it ?

Yaa sure, In this I used a SQL database to query out questions based on player statistics stored in a database. For ex, to answer questions like Which player scored the best or Who was the goalkeeper to save most goals
Ok, can you tell me difference between Sql and No Sql databases ?

SQL databases are relational and have a structured schema, while NoSQL databases are non-relational, providing flexibility with a schema-less approach and diverse data models. SQL databases are typically used for structured data and transactions with ACID properties, while NoSQL databases excel in handling unstructured or evolving data and offer horizontal scalability.
Can you tell ACID properties of databases ?
I don't know all of them but I know A stands for Atomicity and I for Isolation. Sorry I can recall only two of them
No worries, You can try if you want.
No, I don;t think I can answer that one
Well before moving on they are Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durablity. As I can see you were a Data Engineering Intern at Marsh Mclennan. Can you tell me more about it?
Sure, I worked in Corporate Information Solutions at Data Engineering Intern where my task was to develop POC for inhouse AI app
Exicting work!, Can you tell me what challenges you encountered when working with LLM's at scale

Yes, sure initally we were trying to utilize Open source models but hosting and infrencing from that sort of model posed challenges on computational demand and soon trying models with billions of parameters became a challenge. So we utilized Open AI corporate key hosted in organizations secure environments, we utilized LLm at scale
Yea sounds good, What did you most enjoyed during whole period?
Whole journey was exciting but the freedom to try and experiment with any model of my choice was my favourite part.
Nice !, What tools did you utilized regularly during your internship period ?
I used a variety of tools like Azure Databricks, anaconda, vs code, python, nltk, open ai api, Azure Ml studio
Very nice, seems like you got experiecne with cloud. What did you liked most about Azure Databricks ?

Azure Databricks provides a unified analytics platform with Apache Spark, enabling scalable and high-performance data processing while seamlessly integrating with Azure services for enhanced collaboration, productivity, and security.
